alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Salem, Camden and Gloucester Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 613 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Woodstown, or 8 miles southeast of Wilmington, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Cherry Hill, Deptford, Voorhees, West Deptford, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Pennsville, Bellmawr, Woodbury, Pitman, Clayton, Carneys Point, Berlin, Magnolia, Westville, Woodstown, Alloway, Woodbury Heights and Quinton. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 3. Interstate 76 in New Jersey near mile marker 0. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 11, and between mile markers 25 and 36. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 31 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
